bug.author: Bumblebee1964
bug.summary: Error when loading JSON network definition with c++ api
bug.description:
For bugs or installation issues, please provide the following information. The more information you provide, the more likely people will be able to help you. <denchmark-h:h2>Environment info</denchmark-h>
Operating System: Windows 10 Compiler:VS2015 Package used (Python/R/Scala/Julia): MXNet version: 9.0.5 Or if installed from source: MXNet commit hash (git rev-parse HEAD): If you are using python package, please provide Python version and distribution: If you are using R package, please provide R sessionInfo(): <denchmark-h:h2>Error Message:</denchmark-h>
Console output: [12:39:43] C:\Projects\MXNet\Base\dmlc-core\include\dmlc/logging.h:300: [12:39:43] C:\Projects\MXNet\Base\nnvm\src\core\op.cc:55: Check failed: op != nullptr Operator Convolution is not registered [12:39:43] c:\projects\mxnet\base\dmlc-core\include\dmlc\logging.h:300: [12:39:43] c:\projects\mxnet\base\cpp-package\include\mxnet-cpp\symbol.hpp:79: Check failed: MXSymbolCreateFromFile(file_name.c_str(), &(handle)) == 0 (-1 vs. 0) <denchmark-h:h2>Minimum reproducible example</denchmark-h>
if you are using your own code, please provide a short script that reproduces the error. Symbol m_symNetwork = Symbol::Load("C:\DataSets\alex.json"); <denchmark-h:h2>Steps to reproduce</denchmark-h>
or if you are running standard examples, please provide the commands you have run that lead to the error.
<denchmark-h:h2>What have you tried to solve it?</denchmark-h>
Tried to save a network created in code. Then saved to JSON. The JSON output file seems OK. ->But errors is the same. Tried to load one of the sample files from internet (Inception-BN-symbol.json. ->Same error

comments.comment: <denchmark-link:https://github.com/orgs/apache/teams/mxnet-committers>@apache/mxnet-committers</denchmark-link> : This issue has been inactive for the past 90 days. It has no label and needs triage. For general "how-to" questions, our <denchmark-link:https://discuss.mxnet.io/>user forum</denchmark-link> (and <denchmark-link:https://discuss.gluon.ai/>Chinese version</denchmark-link> ) is a good place to get help.
<denchmark-link:https://github.com/nswamy>@nswamy</denchmark-link> please add Bug, C++ to this topic

<denchmark-link:https://github.com/Bumblebee1964>@Bumblebee1964</denchmark-link> Can you please try with the latest MXNet version and if the issue persists, can you. please provide a minimum reproducible example? I have recently submitted a PR <denchmark-link:https://github.com/apache/incubator-mxnet/pull/12930>#12930</denchmark-link> demonstrating how to load model in JSON format.

Hi <denchmark-link:https://github.com/Bumblebee1964>@Bumblebee1964</denchmark-link> there appears to be no update on your end on this issue I am requesting to close it at the moment, please feel free to open it if the problem persists.

Dear Kalyanee,
Thanks for addressing.
Currently we use the Python interface.
We will revert to the C++ api in December using the latest MxNet version. If we still encounter the same problem, we will open the issue.
Regards,
Fred
From: Kalyanee Chendke [mailto:notifications@github.com] Sent: Thursday, 15 November 2018 21:55 To: apache/incubator-mxnet <incubator-mxnet@noreply.github.com> Cc: Fred Hugen <fred@imix.nl>; Mention <mention@noreply.github.com> Subject: Re: [apache/incubator-mxnet] Error when loading JSON network definition with c++ api (<denchmark-link:https://github.com/apache/incubator-mxnet/issues/7771>#7771</denchmark-link> )
